chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ramone A Campbell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Death [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Death [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).
  • Ramone A Campbell was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 40 years bifurcated sentence.   CORRECTED 01-18-2018:  CFTS (credit is not duplicate to that received in revocation)
Consecutive to: Revocation

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

superMiscConds.notes:
**AMENDED 9-22-2017 to add restitution.**
It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order dismissing

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that this appeal is dismissed in favor of further proceedings in the circuit court pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that a WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 postconviction motion shall be filed no later than August 13, 2021.

ORD that Attorney Andrew Walter is discharged as counsel. Ramone Campbell will proceed pro se.
FRO that counsel's no-merit report is rejected. This appeal will proceed under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30.
FRO that no later than May 21, 2021, Campbell shall inform the clerk of this court whether he intends to file an appellant's brief in this appeal or a WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 postconviction motion in the circuit court.
FRO that Campbell shall comply with the Rules of Appellate Procedure with regard to service of documents filed in this court.
FRO that appointed appellate counsel is bound by the requirements of SCR 20:1.16(d) which govern a lawyer's obligations upon the termination of representation.
FRO that this appeal remains stayed pending further order of this court.

ORD no later than May 4, 2021, Ramone Campbell shall file the response required by this order. Campbell shall provide a copy of his response to his appointed appellate counsel.
FRO that this appeal is stayed pending further order of this court.

Defendant Ramone A Campbell in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Ramone A Campbell in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams & Antoinette Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Def- Requesting an adjournment of the sentencing. After review the PSI would be requesting another agent do a new PSI and be allowed to have a private PSI done.
St- No objection to the adjournment but would object to a new PSI writer. No objection to having attorney Hamad do a private PSI.
BTC: Adjournment granted. Attorney Hamad to file a memo to the court indicating his concerns about the PSI and the contact information for the family members he would like them to speak with. Prior Convictions & Probationary Status
Defendant's

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond. Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours: Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Do not drive at all.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. No contact with the victims surving family members, RS and JP (person, property, residence or family).  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 10/20/2016  Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program. You must report to room MC340, in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator). All other conditions to remain.**

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Do not drive at all.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).   No contact with the victims survinging family members, RS and JP (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
